item.title: Robin Horton
item.description: Introduction Robin Horton (1932 - 2019), an English social anthropologist and philosopher, has carried out specialised study in comparative religion since the 1950s which has challenged and expanded views in the study of the anthropology of religion. He is notable for his comparison of traditional thought systems (including religion) to Western science. Wikipedia

item.title: Ayahuasca
item.description: Hang on a second The use of mind-altering chemicals is a tricky subject - understanding the effects and possible harms associated with these chemicals is important for anyone interested in human spiritual and religious traditions. However, the information we provide is not intended to encourage anyone to break the law, nor to put their own health at risk. Our Entheogen articles will, where possible, include links to impartial drug information pages.
